title: Image of the Month: How to Select the Ideal Surgical Approach in Male Anorectal Malformation with No Visible Fistula
patient: A 6-month-old male infant with an anorectal malformation (ARM) who underwent a colostomy as a newborn, now presents to your clinic for preoperative planning for his definitive repair. You review the distal colostogram (\n) to assist you in identifying the nature of the malformation as well as to decide on the ideal surgical approach for the repair.
